final_answer.precision_note: Answer given to 3 significant figures, limited by the least precise input: current (1.50 A), time (30.0 min), and Faraday constant (96500 C mol-1).

method: First, convert time to seconds: t = 30.0 min × 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge using Q = I × t: Q = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons using n(e-) = Q/F: n(e-) = 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.0280 mol. From the half-equation, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of Cu, so n(Cu) = 0.0280 / 2 = 0.0140 mol. Calculate mass: m = n × Ar = 0.0140 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
